title: As water shortages intensify Iran’s heat wave, authorities shift blame
description: In a growing country of some 88 million people, mired in droughts exacerbated by climate change, experts say the damage is irreversible.

title: Prighozin faces lawsuit over alleged Wagner executions in Libya
description: A Libyan national who says he escaped summary execution by Russian Wagner Group mercenaries filed a lawsuit in a court in Washington on Tuesday naming as defendant the group’s founder — Yevgeniy Prigozhin.

title: Prigozhin faces lawsuit over alleged Wagner executions in Libya
description: A Libyan national who says he escaped summary execution by Russian Wagner Group mercenaries filed a lawsuit in a court in Washington on Tuesday naming as defendant the group’s founder — Yevgeniy Prigozhin.

title: Biden’s asylum changes reduced border crossings. But are the rules legal?
description: A court challenge being heard Wednesday could upend the calm on the U.S. side of the border and reshape America’s role as a refuge for foreigners fleeing harm.

title: ‘Disturbing’ decline in global nuclear security, watchdog says
description: For the first time since it began in 2012, the Nuclear Threat Index has found that security had gotten worse rather than better.

title: In photos: Here’s how the world is dealing with extreme heat
description: As the Northern Hemisphere approaches summer’s peak, heat is testing the limits of human survival in Earth’s hottest spots.

title: U.S. national detained by North Korea after crossing border, U.N. says
description: The American was on a tour of the Joint Security Area in the demilitarized zone when he crossed into North Korea, the United Nations said.

title: Chinese real estate giant reveals staggering $81 billion loss amid slump
description: One of the largest apartment builders in China, Evergrande slid into distress in 2021, causing global alarm amid fears it could start another financial crisis.

title: Not just about money: New Zealand women fight for rights on soccer field
description: A messy fight for equity at an Auckland club shows how difficult it is to get trickle-down parity in women’s soccer even when the national teams manage it.

title: What to know about the grain deal that Russia just pulled out of
description: Russia suspended its participation in a U.N.-brokered deal with Ukraine that allowed some 33 million tons of food products to be exported, in a blow to food security.

title: Ukraine live briefing: End of grain deal sparks concern over food prices; Putin vows response to Crimean Bridge attack
description: Russia decided to “hold humanity hostage,” the U.S. ambassador to the U.N. said about the end of the Black Sea grain deal, which allowed Ukrainian food exports.

title: Ukraine aims to sap Russia’s defenses, as U.S. urges a decisive breakthrough
description: Ukraine is making limited advances recapturing Russian-held territory, but has yet to employ the larger-scale operations U.S. officials say could enable a breakthrough.

title: A new generation faces growing prospect of another genocide in Darfur
description: Targeted killings of civilians and ethnic cleansing in western Sudan increasingly resemble the horrors of 2003, according to survivor accounts.

title: Crimea looms in the crosshairs as Ukraine’s counteroffensive bogs down
description: After a week of summitry and politicking, all eyes returned to the war after Ukraine attacked the Crimean Bridge.
